title: One Piece: Ocean's Dream Arc (Filler) | Summary, Recap & Review
author: Poggers Blog
description: A comprehensive recap and review of the Ocean's Dream Arc (episodes 220-224). The reviewer rates it 7/10, praising it for bringing laughs and unique character moments, though noting it lacks the depth of the main story. Describes the premise of losing one's memory due to a hypnotic seahorse as a clever and original idea.

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains spoilers for the entire Ocean's Dream Arc

title: One Piece "Ocean's Dream" 220-226
author: grimCONvenience
description: A critical review of the Ocean's Dream Arc, calling it "stupid, pointless arcs" and noting that "The arc didn't really make much sense." The reviewer points out plot inconsistencies with the seahorse's memory-stealing abilities and recommends skipping these filler episodes entirely.

title: Blind Reaction To: One Piece Episodes 220-226
author: Unknown Creator
description: A blind reaction video covering the entire Ocean's Dream Arc, including episode 220. The creator watches and reacts to the episodes without prior knowledge of the storyline.

title: One Piece: 15 Anime Arcs You Can Skip
author: GameRant
description: An article listing filler arcs in One Piece that viewers can skip. The Ocean's Dream Arc is mentioned as skippable, with the article noting it "feels more like a tonal disruption than an innovative set of episodes" with a "lack of character development" that "makes it an absolute must-skip for first-time watchers."

title: One Piece Filler Episodes and Arcs You Can Skip
author: CBR
description: A comprehensive guide to One Piece filler content. The Ocean's Dream Arc is described as "a fun detour" but notes the entertainment level is "mostly mild" and as "pure filler, watching it might be debatably time wasted."

title: 10 Best 'One Piece' Filler Arcs You Shouldn't Skip
author: FandomWire
description: An article listing the best One Piece filler arcs. The Ocean's Dream Arc is mentioned positively, described as "a short and intriguing filler that uses memory loss as its central theme." The article notes it's "based on a video game" and "follows the Straw Hats losing their memories, so while they do revert to before they joined up as a crew, it also shows how much they've developed since. It's pure entertainment and nostalgia."

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains plot details about the arc

title: One Piece Filler List & Episode to Chapter Conversion Guide 2025
author: Anime Filler Guide
description: A comprehensive database listing all One Piece episodes and identifying which are filler. Episodes 220-224 are marked as filler episodes that make up the Ocean's Dream Arc.

title: Episode 220 - One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
description: The official wiki page for Episode 220, containing detailed information about the episode including title, air dates, plot summary, character appearances, production credits, and trivia. The page notes this is the first episode of the Ocean's Dream Arc with a TV rating of 11.2%.

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains full plot details and arc information

title: Ocean's Dream Arc - One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
description: Comprehensive wiki page about the Ocean's Dream Arc, covering all episodes 220-224. Includes plot summary, character information about Drim and Noko, and notes that the arc is based on the PlayStation game 'One Piece: Ocean's Dream!'

title: Noko - One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
description: Character wiki page for Noko, the seahorse antagonist of the Ocean's Dream Arc. Details his abilities (memory theft, hypnosis, illusions), motivation to become a Sennenryu dragon, and his relationship with Drim. Includes voice actor information.

title: Drim - One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
description: Character wiki page for Drim, the young boy controlled by Noko in the Ocean's Dream Arc. Details his appearance, role as an antagonist under hypnosis, and his relationship with his mother. Notes that he has no inherent abilities and only serves as Noko's agent.
